title: MAT 118: Elementary Statistics (OER)
text:
Prerequisites: Placement level 2, ENG 101 placement, or HS GPA of 3.0 (83)[cite: 6].
Course Description: Basic statistical procedures including descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, and regression using simulation and theory-based approaches[cite: 10, 11].
Learning Outcome: Students will use quantitative reasoning to work with graphical and numerical models[cite: 14].

title: MAT 118: Elementary Statistics (OER)
text:
Instructor Contact & Office Hours

Office: Washington 114 [cite: 25]
Email: henry.mendozarivera@sunydutchess.edu (Best way to contact)[cite: 25].
Office Hours: Appointments can be made via Brightspace[cite: 30].Drop-ins are welcome at the Math & Science Center (Washington 126) during scheduled times[cite: 32, 33].

title: MAT 118: Elementary Statistics (OER)
text:
Required Materials

Textbook: This is an OER course.Materials are free for electronic use via Brightspace[cite: 52].
Technology: Microsoft Excel is required.A Chromebook is NOT sufficient as it cannot support the necessary Excel features[cite: 56, 57].
Brightspace: All readings, videos, and assignments are hosted at mylearning.suny.edu[cite: 49, 50].

ImportantLate Work Policy



[cite_start]Computer and Written Homework are NEVER accepted late for any reason[cite: 97, 105].To account for life circumstances, the lowest grades for several categories (homework, quizzes) are dropped at the end of the semester[cite: 98, 102, 106].

title: MAT 118: Elementary Statistics (OER)
text:
Academic Policies

Academic Integrity
[cite_start]Academic dishonesty (cheating, plagiarism, unauthorized AI use) will result in a 0 for the assignment and will be reported to the college[cite: 131, 132, 227].A second offense results in a failing grade for the course[cite: 228].


AI Policy
[cite_start]Students must not use AI to generate material for any assignment unless explicitly instructed to do so[cite: 251].


Academic Accommodations
[cite_start]Students with documented disabilities must register with the Office of Accommodative Services (OAS) in Orcutt Student Services Building, Room 103[cite: 189, 193].

[cite_start]For the full tentative schedule and exam dates, please refer to the calendar posted on Brightspace. [cite: 185]

title: MAT 118: Elementary Statistics (OER)
text:
Student Support & Wellbeing

Starfish
Starfish is used to connect you to faculty and support services.Please check your DCC email and log into Starfish daily for feedback[cite: 233, 234, 236].


Health and Wellbeing
[cite_start]The DCC Counseling Center provides short-term individual and group counseling to help you achieve your goals[cite: 242].If you or someone you know is in crisis, call or text the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline at 988[cite: 245].
